laboratory_examinations.findings: 20 to 50 red cells per high-power field and 1+ proteinuria. Microscopic examination disclosed dysmorphic red cells and two cellular casts thought to be red-cell casts.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Complete Blood Count (CBC), Electrolyte Levels, Renal Function Tests

laboratory_examinations.findings: Positive for hepatitis B antibody, negative for hepatitis B antigen and hepatitis C antibodies.
Contained 1152 mg of creatinine and 160 mg of protein.

Glomeruli were normal except for focal, mild mesangial hypercellularity. Slight segmental linear staining for IgG and albumin. Diffusely thin glomerular basement membranes with focal areas of thickening and scalloping.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Two years after the diagnostic biopsy, the patient remains well, with no evidence of progressive renal disease, continuing with microscopic hematuria and stable mild proteinuria.
